title: AppliedCustomerBillingRate
description: Applied Customer Billing Rate extended with relatedParty property

id.description: Unique identifier of the customer applied billing rate

href.description: Explanation: Reference of the customer applied billing rate.

isBilled.description: If isBilled = true then bill should be provided, if false then billingAccount should be provided

date.description: Creation date of the applied billing rate

description.description: Additional data to be displayed on the bill for this customer applied billing rate

name.description: Name of the customer applied billing rate

periodCoverage.description: periodCoverage for RecurringCharge (RC) indicating the RC coverage period dates for different purposes, such as RC proration, display on bill, GL reporting, etc. periodCoverage for OC start and end date will be the same

appliedBillingRateType.description: Type of the applied billing rate : appliedBillingCharge (any kind of charge except taxation charges : recurringCharge, oneTimeCharge, usageCharge),  appliedBillingCredit (any kind of credit : rebate or productAlteration) or appliedPenaltyCharge (penalty charges such as late fees, payment rejection fees,...)

product.description: Usually this information should be provided by the PRODUCT, which implies that there is a valid reference to product. In this case, this property should be empty. For all other situations, a text or structured info could be provided using this property. Regular modelling would suggest tu use the reforvalue pattern for this case. It is not choosen here because it would generate declarational dependencies which would be hard to maintain.

items.description: Dynnamically needed additional information for the specific billitem, here named 'appliedCustomerBillingRate'. It should come from a catalog with the value and the schemas for the presentation on the bill
